name: Hitachi tunnel down.txt - Resolving Hitachi Tunnel Down Alert
description: This section explains the steps to resolve a Hitachi Tunnel Down Alert, which is related to a VPN connection between AWS and Hitachi. It involves identifying the active and inactive VPN tunnels, modifying the static routes associated with the tunnels to redirect traffic from the down tunnel to the active tunnel, and ensuring that the IP addresses are correctly configured in the static routes.
use_cases: Redirecting network traffic between VPN tunnels
Managing static routes for VPN connections
Troubleshooting and maintaining AWS site-to-site VPN connections

name: Hitachi tunnel down.txt - Static Routes IPs
description: This section lists a set of IP addresses with subnet masks, which appear to be static routes configured for network communication. Static routes are manually defined paths for data to travel between networks or devices, ensuring reliable connectivity even when dynamic routing protocols fail or are not available. These IP addresses likely represent specific destinations or gateways that network traffic needs to reach.
use_cases: Failover or backup routing when dynamic protocols fail
Controlling traffic flow to specific destinations
Securing network access by defining explicit routes

name: Hitachi tunnel down.txt - Additional Notes
description: This section provides additional troubleshooting steps to resolve payment failures related to the Mozart service. If switching the VPN does not resolve the issue, it suggests rotating (restarting or replacing) the Mozart service pods. It emphasizes the importance of monitoring the pods for stability after the rotation process to ensure the issue is resolved.
use_cases: Resolving issues with the Mozart service

name: Hitachi tunnel down.txt - Modify Dashboard/Alert after change
description: This section explains that if none of the Hitachi tunnels are operational, you need to contact the Hitachi support team to investigate and resolve the issue. It suggests that in the event of a complete failure of the Hitachi tunnel system, the user should escalate the matter to the vendor's support personnel for troubleshooting and resolution.
use_cases: Monitoring the status of Hitachi tunnels
Escalating issues related to Hitachi tunnel failures
Contacting Hitachi support for assistance with tunnel-related problems

name: Hitachi tunnel down.txt - Steps to Fix Alert
description: This section explains how to modify a Grafana dashboard and alert settings after a change in the VPN tunnel configuration. It provides step-by-step instructions to access the relevant dashboard, edit the query to point to the new tunnel details, and save the changes to resolve the alert and display the updated data graphs.
